"Initial Setup: 1. About -> Build Number -> Click 7 times 2. Developer Settings -> Wireless ADB Debugging -> On 3. Developer Settings -> ADB Debugging -> On
Troubleshooting
Attempt #1: 1. Help -> Reset
Attempt #2: 1. Close LADB 2. Enable Airplane Mode (Android 10 and below) 3. Clear any existing Wireless Debugging connections (Android 11 and above) 4. Disconnect all USB devices 5. Open LADB
Attempt #3: 1. Close LADB 2. Developer Settings -> Wireless ADB Debugging -> Off 3. Developer Settings -> ADB Debugging -> Off 4. Developer Settings -> Revoke authorizations 5. Reboot 6. Developer Settings -> Wireless ADB Debugging -> On 7. Developer Settings -> ADB Debugging -> On 8. Enable Airplane Mode (Android 10 and below) 9. Open LADB
Still confused? Email me at tylernij@gmail.com."

"You can find the port and the 6-digit pairing code here: Settings -> Developer Settings -> Wireless Debugging
Be aware, the port and pairing code change upon closing the window. Open LADB and Settings using Split Screen to prevent the code from changing."
Restore the app to factory settings, erasing pairing information and ADB server files

This error is one of the most common. Often, it can be fixed by rebooting the device. Another possible way to fix this for Android 10 users and below is to enable Airplane Mode because launching the app. Remember that after rebooting the device, Wireless Debugging may turn off and need to be turned on again.
